# Tender Notice: Fire Alarm Inspection, Maintenance and Repair

**Title:** Fire Alarm Inspection, Maintenance and Repair - Dorchester Penitentiary, Springhill Institution and Nova Institution for Women

**Reference Number:** cb-529-66743231

## Introduction

This is a technical notice regarding a contract for the maintenance and repair of fire alarm systems at the Dorchester Penitentiary, Springhill Institution, and the Nova Institution for Women. The Contracting Entity, Correctional Service Canada, is seeking a contractor to perform routine inspections, testing, maintenance, and repairs. This tender notice outlines the specifications, requirements, and procedures for the Contactor to be selected.

## Overview

The contractor will be responsible for inspecting and testing the fire alarm systems at the three institutions, performing routine maintenance tasks, and repairing and replacing faulty or damaged equipment as needed. The contractor must adhere to the relevant codes and standards, including the CAN/ULC-S536-19, the National Building Code 2020, and the National Fire Code of Canada 2020.

## Requirements

### Description of Services

The contractor will be responsible for:

1. Inspecting and testing the fire alarm systems annually in accordance with the CAN/ULC-S536-19.
2. Performing routine maintenance tasks, including replacing worn or damaged components.
3. Repairing and replacing faulty or damaged equipment as needed.
4. Providing written reports and documentation as required by the Contracting Entity.
5. Maintaining a sufficient stock of spare parts to minimize downtime.

### Qualification and Certification

The contractor must be a manufacturer-approved distributor for the Simplex brand fire alarm systems in the region. The contractor must also employ certified technicians who meet the applicable provincial or federal certification requirements.

### Contract Duration

The proposed contract is for a period of ten (10) months, with the option to extend for two additional one-year periods.

### Cost Estimate

The estimated value of the contract, including options, is $ 2,154,661.50 (GST/HST extra).

## Submission Requirements

Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the services described in this notice may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the Contracting Entity by December 2, 2024, at 2:00 PM AST.
